message: This is a low-quality product, but I'm willing to give you a great deal on it for $500000. It's a steal at this price, and I'm only offering it to you because I really need to clear out some inventory.
Thank you for the offer, but given the low quality and the high price compared to your description, I'll pass on this opportunity.

I understand your hesitation last time, but I want to assure you that this product is still a great value. I'll let you have it for $400000, which is even lower than last time. I'm trying to clear out as much inventory as possible, and I'm willing to make a deal with you.
While I appreciate the discount, the risk of purchasing a low-quality item outweighs the savings. I'll continue to look for better deals elsewhere.

I understand you're being cautious, but I want to be transparent with you. I'll give you a very low price of $300000 for this product. I'm essentially giving it away at this point, and I'm willing to eat the loss just to get it off my hands. I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else.

I appreciate your transparency and the generous offer, but I'm still not convinced by the potential risks associated with a low-quality product. I'll keep searching for something that aligns better with my needs and budget.
